item.title: Bunny add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Fairy tales do not tell children the dragons exist. Children already know that dragons exist. Fairy tales tell children the dragons can be killed." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Bunny add a quote by Francisco Goya
item.description: "Fantasy abandoned by reason produces impossible monsters" -- Francisco Goya

item.title: Bunny add a quote by Frank Miller
item.description: "The noir hero is a knight in blood caked armor. He's dirty and he does his best to deny the fact that he's a hero the whole time." -- Frank Miller

item.title: Bunny add a quote by Arthur Rubinstein
item.description: "Of course there is no formula for success, except perhaps an unconditional acceptance of life, and what it brings" -- Arthur Rubinstein

item.title: Bunny add a quote by Adam Gidwitz
item.description:
"You see, Hansel and Gretel don’t just show up at the end of this story.
They show up.
And then they get their heads cut off.
Just thought you’d like to know." -- Adam Gidwitz

item.title: Bunny add a quote by Adam Gidwitz
item.description: "Once upon a time, fairy tales were AWESOME!" -- Adam Gidwitz

item.title: Bunny add a quote by Maggie Kuhn
item.description: "Speak your mind even if your voice shakes." -- Maggie Kuhn

item.title: Bunny add a quote by Marissa Meyer
item.description: "Vanity is a factor, but it is more a question of control. It is easier to trick others into perceiving you as beautiful if you can convince yourself you are beautiful. But mirrors have an uncanny way of telling the truth." -- Marissa Meyer

item.title: Bunny add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "That's the thing about destiny: It can't be predicted, and it's usually pretty odd." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Bunny add a quote by Maria Montessori
item.description: "Imagination does not become great until human beings, given the courage and the strength, use it to create." -- Maria Montessori
